review: The food was fine, the service was okay.  Two points: 1. If you let your kids play on that device on the table you will be charged an 'entertainment fee'. 2. There's so much promotional crap on the table there's no room for the food.

Coming back to this location was a horrible mistake. Got our order wrong twice and when the manager came the second time, we told him it was still wrong and he says "sorry" and walks away. They took it off the bill (which they should have) but still were extremely rude and not at all accommodating. Our server did not come back ONCE even though neither of us got drink refills. Oh actually, at the end he came to bring the check and blames his lack of attention or service on the fact that he just got a 32 person table. Completely understandable..... except for the fact that the table had 17 people at it and was already being taken care of by 2 different servers..... it was a little busy in there but not really. I understand a couple of mistakes here and there, but this place is horrible. Going to continue to steer people away from this restaurant! One of the worst places in apex please don't go here unless you are looking to spend an unnecessarily long time, receive awful service, or the wrong order. Wasn't expecting anything different from this location but definitely never making the mistake of coming here again! Very bad!

The only reason I am giving them 2 stars is because the food is good.  The service here absolutely sucked! They brought out one burger that was wrong. Another one that was raw. It took over twenty minutes to bring out another properly cooked burger. Also asked for crispy fries at the start. The only Timmons I received them was five minutes after the last burger arrived, and well after all of the food on the table was eaten. I heard "I'm sorry" about a dozen times. When the manager showed up and I told her that my order was wrong, she responded with a sarcastic answer. By the way her name is Kristen, as she repeatedly told me every time she came out to give us the heating progress of the raw burger. When I called her out on the sarcasm, our dinner was free. Don't waste your money here, spend five bucks more a person and go to Longhorn Steakhouse next door.
UPDATE:  Health Inspection Score of 93.5 went up to 97.  Amazing improvement!

Usual service good but not great. Everyone seems a little overwhelmed on the floor.  Burger was okay, not as juicy as I like, but than its hard to get a juicy well done burger. I will not order a medium well burger at a chain store, that doesn't use daily fresh ground beef.  Fries we good. My kids liked there burgers and chicken fingeres.

It was really my fault. I knew I was at Red Robin- where even their "signature burgers" aren't good. Honestly, if you're not even good at making what you're known for, what are we even doing? But acquiescing to the wishes of the rest of my extended family, I found myself at Red Robin on a Sunday night. This was only the first of many poor decisions.  The second was ordering an appetizer. This actually only proved to be disastrous because our waitress forgot to ever put the order in. Explaining to hungry kids that the food they were expecting is no longer coming is a less than thrilling adventure. The waitress was apologetic, but otherwise the action was forgotten. We were admittedly a large table, but we were also one of only 4 tables seated in the entire restaurant. The manager clearly believed (incorrectly) that our lone server could handle it by herself. This might have something to do with the entire staff of the restaurant being under 25 years of age and seemingly (erroneously) believing that they were living out the plot of the movie "Waiting". I get it. Service industry jobs are hard and you've got to break up the monotony somehow, but keep the games and flirting in the back- at least while I'm still waiting on my (bad) food.  Our food arrived. Well- most of it. It took an extra 10min to get my 9-year-old his grilled cheese and fries. Clearly that's a complicated order. My crab cake "burger" was heinously bad. The ciabatta roll was dry. The arugula was wilted. The "garlic aioli" was thin mayonnaise with no detectable garlic or acidity. The crab cake itself was a frozen, straight-from-the-bag holocaust of mushy "crab" and bell peppers that tasted like Frisky cat food. My cousin's cheeseburger arrived with an extra hair as a garnish.  Again- this was my mistake. All of this could've been avoided had I merely insisted that my family avoid a chain restaurant that I knew to be particularly bad even among chain restaurants and walk across the parking lot to Tyler's where the food is fresh and no more expensive. Unfortunately I played the peacemaker and ultimately paid the price.

How far the great Red Robin has fallen - perhaps it's all the high-end burger competition now but this chain has done everything to cut costs to the bone and as usual, we are now seeing pretty consistent drops in quality and service. Kiosks on the table to increase efficiency and reduce wait staff now gives license for wait staff to ignore you. Remember those bottomless steak fry baskets? Not anymore - sure, the menu says bottomless but they start you with a little metal sleeve of fries now and then drag out bringing you any refills until you just want to go back in the kitchen and make them yourself. The burgers are still pretty good but the prices just keep climbing. The whole experience has declined from the decor and cleanliness to the up-selling of apps, drinks and desserts to the downscaling of the food and service. Goodbye Red Robin - we're off to 5 Guys or BurgerFi - at least there we know exactly what we are getting and it is consistent.

I have to say recent reviews are fairly accurate.  Service is pretty bad.  Every step of the meal moves at a glacial rate.  The waitress was often not around for extended periods.  I had to flag her down once across the room by waving my white napkin.   An ice tea refill took a very long time even after she had noted mine was empty and asked if I needed refill.  She did not take old glass when she brought a new one.  The new glass had a giant chip on the bottom corner - should have been thrown away.  There was clutter all over the table.  They leave various menus on the table hoping you'll order more drinks or dessert.  Main courses took a long time to arrive - hamburgers! She kind of jammed the check on us while we were still eating but then took forever to pick it up and a long time to return.  The whole meal went like that.   I can say in her favor she was decently friendly but no idea how to do a good job as a waitress.   Multiple tables around us were not cleaned off long after the patrons had left.  There were a lot of empty tables too so it wasn't an over-crowded time.   Here's the topper - when we left there was at least 5 or 6 groups of people waiting for tables.   The food was okay.  The burger was good, the sweet tea was good. Fries were bitter (old oil), daughter's milk shake was not bad, nothing out of the ordinary.  My wife said the Alaskan Crabcake sandwich (close to $15 IIRC) was terrible.  Nothing special here, Five Guys burgers are slightly better and less expensive.   Overall surprising how bad the service is.  There's all these reviews that say that but no improvement.  Guess they don't read Yelp.  One glitch is okay but here it was one thing after another.  I eat at the one in Charlotte occasionally and it has none of these problems.  We won't return to this establishment, that's pretty clear.

The burgers were above average, but not as good as other places we have been to this year. The wait to get in was about 20 minutes on a Friday night. While we were waiting my wife had a large blue moon which is about $7. We paid the extra $0.99 per entree to get the special garlic herb crusted fries with the shaved parmesan cheese... But they never arrived . So we asked for seconds on the bottomless fries but they didn't come until after we paid the bill because it took so long they forgot about them. To our server's credit she boxed them up for us, but the magic eludes them  on the warm up at home. I will say this, I am a heavy Diet Coke drinker and I was never without. The problem with Red Robin is there are too many children lurking about lol.

Let's start with the sanitation grade...90. Not impressive, hence the 3 stars. But, there was no wait so we were seated immediately. The waitress was kind and pretty responsive on bringing drink refills, etc.  I probably wouldn't go back but their Fiesta Chicken Salad was soooo yummy as usual. And, I'm fully addicted to their steak fries.

11am Sunday morning. Service was ok. Only 2-3 other tables and the server was friendly but not real attentive. It does seem they are way under staffed or they just don't care. Not sure which.  I had the BBQ chicken salad. It was very good. Lettuce was fresh, chicken was hot.  Wife had the soup and salad. The tortilla soup was fabulous.  We have been here many times but not recently, and I think they need an attitude adjustment back to customer Service.  Might return again.

We've eaten here four or five times over the past year, mainly because our seven-year-old likes Red Robin for the games in the lobby and grilled cheese sandwiches on the menu. He'd probably give the place five stars when they throw in a milkshake. I was on the fence between two and three stars (probably overthinking here) because although the service is always slower than it ought to be, the staff generally seem like decent people who individually are not out to ruin anyone's night. I'm going with two stars after tonight's visit because of the sticky tabletop and greasy silverware--thankfully I ordered a burger and didn't actually need to touch the greasy fork, but it still gave me the creeps sitting there next to my plate. Speaking of food, it's not that great once you're out of your grilled cheese sandwich phase. The burgers are giant, and a bit expensive in my opinion for assembly line chow, though they do come with every topping known to man. My fries were soggy tonight--think drive-through vintage ten miles down the road. There are better burgers within driving distance--Five Guys comes to mind (I'm sure there are others, but we're still learning the area). My other problem is the service is painfully slow and sporadic. If they're busy, expect to spend close to an hour waiting for your food to arrive. Even when they aren't busy, food takes 20 minutes to reach your table. Maybe that's why they have all those knickknacks on the walls so you have something to look at while you wait. And wait. The biggest disappointment to me is Red Robin doesn't have to be terrible. We used to frequent one in another city that was blazing fast and served hot, crisp fries every time. I wish that one was closer. But then I would probably eat Red Robin too often, and that wouldn't be good, either. Sigh.

Burgers and other food were very good. The condiments and promos at the table were disgusting -- obviously not cleaned in a long time, if ever. The beer list provided was four months old, much of it no longer available. Server wasn't on top of things, but did make things right throughout the visit. I'd prefer to not have to ask for silverware after our food has arrived. She was very friendly. A nice place for families -- I've never seen so many kids in a restaurant in my life as I did on a recent Friday night. A little bit of work and this will be a four star review in the future.

Very good burgers but that's about it. I've never enjoyed their salads or chicken sandwiches, etc. And SLOW! Always so d@mn slow! Waiting for the waiter, waiting for the food. Waiting..! Tonight it took 8 minutes for our waiter to make his first appearance at our table. I know, I know, there are children starving in Africa and I had to wait 8 minutes. But this is America and I'm your customer, so come over to the table and say hi can I get you a drink within the first couple minutes! Or at the very least, understand that the check is smaller cause we'd figured out our order so I didn't get an appetizer and your tip ain't gonna be 20%. Did I mention they have good hamburgers?!? Lucky them..!

Some of these negative reviews patrons left for Red Robin are "for the birds"! Okay, Red Robin isn't some hoity-toity, fine dining restaurant, and shouldn't be compared to or reviewed as such. Red Robin is the go-to restaurant for families with children. They have TV's, arcade games, balloons, crayons and activity placemats, they sing loudly to customers with birthdays, they serve milkshakes, burgers and "bottomless" fries, etc. This all isn't for the snooty, formal-dining adult, it's to keep young diners entertained throughout the meal. Red Robin is known for their good food, large portions and fair prices, and this is what we always receive here. The restaurant is always clean, the service is always prompt, and the food is always served hot. When your a parent, it's not always easy to find a restaurant that welcomes families with small children.

I'd give this a zero star rating if I could.  Our server, Matt was "flustered" as the manager put it. I should've known walking in when the host seated us and ran that this meal would be problematic. Apparently walking customers to a table, dropping the menus and joining the Happy Birthday sing-a-long is more important than making guests feel welcome.  Our server, Matt took our orders down and a few minutes later brought said orders to the table. We noticed a side of broccoli was missing and we asked for ranch. He never brought those items. We had to wait until the manager strolled around to get our missing items. Matt did stop by to drop our check halfway through our meal "for our convenience".....our? We told him we needed it split and I also had to ask for a refill of water at that point. He brought the water but never returned with the checks. Finally, after sitting there for what seemed like an eternity, manager walks past again. We told him we needed the checks and he apologized and said Matt the waiter was flustered, which I don't buy because we saw him standing around chatting quite a bit. Not to mention the place was almost dead - 4 maybe 5 tables of 2-4 people and plenty of servers. We saw at least one other table doing the neck strain/attempt to make eye contact look that was all too familiar from our experience.  We never saw good old Matt other than to take our orders and bring us our check way too early. For the first time in forever, I didn't tip -that's right.  If I could've left without paying a dime for that crap experience, I would've.

We love Red Robin, but this one was disgustingly unclean. The table was not even wiped down. Sticky, with chunks of food and dried puddles of ice cream. The floor had tons of squished french fries. Asked the hostess to clean it and her effort was terrible and incomplete. Then it was 20 minutes before our server even came by to say hello. Pathetic.

Out running errands and we had our puppy with us; we came here since they have outdoor seating. It was strange because no one acknowledged the dog, but they gave us some weird looks. Maybe they don't actually allow dogs, but there was no one else outside so they left it alone...? Not sure, it definitely felt strange.  It was a chilly day but there was some sun that helped warm us up. I imagine on a really hot day there would be too sun for it to be pleasant outside.  Menu was re-done from the last time we went (about year+) so a little overwhelming. Anyway food was fine, got a burger and a crispy chicken sandwich with fries. Asked for hot sauce with the chicken sandwich and they remembered it so we did not have to ask twice, which is a plus service-wise!  Got the fruffles for dessert which were pretty good! The picture shows sauce and whipped cream for dipping and they put the whipped cream on plate more for decoration than dipping. They are very rich so took them to go. I noticed after keeping them in the fridge that they were much softer than at the restaurant - my guess is they keep them frozen - they get much better once they have some time to thaw out!

I ordered my food to go at the bar.  The bartender was good and personable however I ordered a wedge salad that I didn't get.  I wasn't charged so I guess he forgot to ring it in.  The food I received was horrible!!  The fish was very bland and the three pieces were small and overcooked.  The whisky river chicken was very hard and not palatable.  I threw it away.  If I ever feel like Red Robin food,  I will travel to the Cary location where I have had a 100% better overall experience!

What's there really to say? All Red Robins are generally the same.  Our server was new and super shy, you could barely hear her when she spoke which was sweet but not effective. Food was fine and prompt. I thought the fries were bottomless? We weren't asked if we wanted more which was surprising.

Solid average burger for the price overall. So armed Robin has always been a pretty neat place. I like the burger selections and I like the bottomless fries. I have never had much problems with the staff. They were always very friendly. Now to the not so good. After ordering it took a really long time to get the food. It was around 20 minutes? This was for one double burger and one specialty burger. Speaking for the double burger, the meat was dry when eating. Nice glove it's though. The bun started getting soggy fast. I probably took about 3-4 minutes eating it before the sogginess. Overall a decent place for the price but I would expect better for the price.

My parents wanted to go here for dinner because of the extensive menu. The prices are decent for what they offer. My mom had the veggie burger and loved it. My dad had fish and chips and said it was too salty to eat. I had a regular cheeseburger. It was ok, we make better burgers at home. My biggest complaint about Red Robin is the service. It's slow always even when there are few people in the restaurant. I don't understand. They advertise bottomless fries and it's nearly impossible to get them. I guess that's the point! They also advertise bottomless side salad which is also difficult to get.  Probably won't be going back considering how many burger places are available.

We had not been to Red Robin in years.  When the "free birthday burger" arrived in my email we said, let's give it a try. We sat in the bar (to avoid the kids).  Our waitress greeted us promptly and we each ordered a margarita.  I could see the bartender preparing drinks.  I have watched many a bartender in my time.  He was carefully using a jigger to measure each ingredient in every drink.  Maybe he was new ?  Maybe Red Robin requires this to avoid over pours ?  The drinks were delicious so he was doing a good job. My husband got the chili cheese burger and I opted for a cup of chili and a side salad.  Mine was super yummy.  The Dijon vinaigrette was great.  Chili was spicy just like I like it.  My husband said the burger was just "meh"........nothing great about it.  Our waitress was MIA after our food was delivered.  He wanted some more fries but that didn't happen.   She finally showed up with the check.  #ODD.    I wouldn't mind returning for the chili and salad but he said it was a NO on the burger.

went to the Apex location for a quick bite and a beer.... it was VERY nice to not have to sit with young kids (yes there's an adult seating area at the bar)... not that i'm anti-child, but it's nice to be able to go to a "family" resturant and not feel like i'm with my kids/grands.... Burger options are plentyful, got the siracha burger hoping for a good amount of zing... not so much. Still tasty. The beers were cold.... fry baskets are bottomless.... so i can't complain...

I used to LOVE Red Robin. They had the best boca burger that made my vegetarian heart happy. I was disappointed the other day to find out they replaced it for another veggie burger? They already have few options for vegetarians, now they have less. My favorite appetizer was the baha chips! They were amazing! Those are gone as well. I now have 0 reason to come back and I'm really disappointed :(

I was not pleased with the service of this fine establishment. They took several hours to deliver my food and it was not satisfactory. It was very cold outside and I didn't appreciate the weather. I was not pleased at all.

Overall. Food looks good and is on average, tasty. Many of the gourmet burgers are quite expensive. Ranging from 10-13$ for a burger, albeit generally a large portion size but still very pricey. They do have smaller, less expensive options.  The one star rating is due primarily to their lack of delivering to their tag line. When you say that you have bottomless fries, it tends to make you believe that you will receive, well, bottomless fries (within reason of course).  After requesting ONE additional refill on the fries, it was never delivered. Asked the staff there twice and the extra order never arrived.  Waited at least 15-20 minutes and the order never arrived. Not sure what to say about this experience other than to vote with my wallet. That is, I don't intend to dine at the Beaver Creek Red Robin anytime in the near future.

We were originally planning to go to Longhorn but the wait was too long by so we opted for Red Robin. Overall the food was tasty. I ordered the DGB burger which has garlic aioli, sun dried tomatoes and arugula. Red robin boasts about their bottomless fries but that's kinda a fares. They bring out a very small portion of fries and they were cold to boot. It was a while before we were asked if we wanted more fries. Our waitress said it would only be 5 minutes. 20 minutes later we are still waiting for our fries.  Our orders were missing sauces and sides so we had to wait for our waitress to bring us the items. The whole experience was disappointing.  The manager did come by to apologize for the fries.  Unfortunately by the time they came our plates were cleared.  I think next time we will hold out for the wait at longhorn.

I was disgusted with the filth of the restaurant. I noticed how dirty the floors were, then we observed a HUGE COCKROACH running around. We told our server who told the female manager but she didn't even come to talk to us. I had to rush my daughters to finish dinner. It had taken 20 minutes to get help for beverages , they couldn't recommend a gluten friendly option, then the roach, and no apology from management. I told my server I couldn't finish my meal (because, GROSS), and he said just to pay at the kiosk. No apologies, no discount, No thanks.

My burger buddy took me to RR for a Birthday lunch. RR has always been one of my favorite dining options, so I was looking forward to the experience. Arrived around 1pm on a Friday and we were quickly seated by the Hostess in the Bar section. Dustin, the Bartender, greeted us, and told us he would be serving us. At first blush, he was friendly, said all the right things, but he turned out to be inattentive. We had to seek out Restaurant Personnel three times for beverage and fry refills. Understandable if they were burger slammed, but this was not the case.  We each ordered Burgers, I opted for the A-1 variety, complete with a tangy sauce, onion strings, tomato, lettuce. One word...YUM. Bottomless fries were good and freshly cooked, but the portions were tiny. All in all, Burger and Fries-5 star. Fry portions-3 stars. Dustin's service/execution-2 star. Poor service really dampened an otherwise positive experience.

The Steak Fries tasted like burnt/stale oil. The dough rings were just pour quality. The had a very distinct burnt taste and apparently no longer are coated in cinnamon sugar. We will not be returning.

Came in for lunch with my family on Saturday 7/15. Waited at the front door area way too long for someone to walk up and decide to seat us. It was not at all busy and there is no reason for that at all! First negative review was that when you walk in, they advertise a deal for buying a $25 gift card with a free movie ticket. We start by asking our server if we can buy the gift card and then use it during our lunch. Apparently Red Robin will not allow this because you can only use a gift card 6 hours after purchase which is absolutely ridiculous. They would still be getting our money so why deny this? Well, I will tell you why...its so they can get more money out of you. The server should have sent his manager over to speak with us but he did not. We probably would have bought the gift card either way but you had no sales tactic or motivation to work with your customer so we will spend that money elsewhere. We will learn later in our visit why and what type of server he is which is lazy and not motivated for sales whatsoever.  Second and most important part of this review...our server. He starts our visit by telling us it has been a slow day so far. Keep in mind it is just lunch time so to say you are having a slow day is a bit concerning because it is ONLY lunch time!!! He then tells us that he will be going home early based on this. This should have been a red flag for us because once somebody decides to tell you their life story and their issues, it generally means that it will not be a good visit but we went with it because we thought that since he had a slow day, he would be at the top of his game for serving us. WRONG!  Regardless of how slow it was, this lazy fool was not focussed on taking care of us or the interests of Red Robin. He was focussed on going home and we were standing in his way.  We had to ask for refills, he didnt even bring us our food...someone else did, he screwed up our endless fries order and most importantly he kept trying to rush us out the door by coming by and asking if we knew how to use the payment tablet on the table and clearing our table and standing over us while we were trying to finish our meals and have lunch conversation as a family. Listen buddy, I know you are trying to leave but we dont need you standing over us and rushing us out because all you are doing is screwing yourself and your potential tip. If you want to leave so bad, just come by once and tell us you are transferring our tab to a more capable server that will actually be there and is not being sent home. Your schedule has NOTHING to do with me and my family and the money we are spending at Red Robin!!!! So when he comes for the last time to stand over us and try to clear more off the table and get us out, I make a statement "You must be trying to get out of here" and his answer is "yes, I am...you are my last table and I am going home". Again...this is lunch time!!!! And we are your last table!?!?! Clearly there is a reason you are being sent home. In my opinion you should have been sent home for good because you just cost Red Robin Apex NC a good customer!...and yes, I will tell anyone I know in this area to stay away from this location!
Earlier this week stopped for lunch !! The whiskey wrap was sooo good . Service was fast and everyone was friendly  Thanks everyone

Service is incredibly slow on an un-busy night. Can't tell if the problem was the server or kitchen or both. Food was served luke warm rather than hot. I sent back a bowl of soup and waited 15 min for replacement that was hot but half full. Poor experience all around.
Our waitress Sage was really nice. The Red Robin cheeseburger was super good and the fries are great.

Super great location and family friendly environment. Lots of menu options. Some healthy, or vegan or cheesy goodness. Great service. Usually don't have to wait long. Reward program for frequent visitors. Refills available on sides. Games at the tables for kids.

I've always through Red Robin to be closer to the 'mediocre' side of the scale but the last exerpience was very refreshing.  Went with four friends to lunch.  We're seated/served promptly and cheerfully and the food was above expectations.  Waiter was prompt and diligent returning with drinks/sauces and of course the bottomless fries.  He had a family emergency to attend to, so we were notified and had another server immediately with us.  Even at the end splitting the bill four equal ways was no issue and the waitress aided us jovially.  All in all great way to start an afternoon and surprisingly good.

The food and service are fine, but we had an issue with the tablets at the table that really marred our experience.  First we noticed a $1.99 entertainment fee.  Apparently this fee is charged if children play the tablet.  There is no requirement for adult consent.  Either the games should be free or they should require a credit card to play the games.  The manager removed the fee, but it took time and we had to ask.  It comes off as a very underhanded business tactic.  Then we tried to pay, we used a rewards card for a free birthday. Originally it took off the hamburger, then we added a tip.  When we swiped the card it asked us to add the tip again and added back the previously free hamburger.  We removed the hamburger and added the tip and swiped the card, then selected to option for the tablet to print a receipt which it did not do. We went to the bar and requested a receipt and the hamburger was added back and the tip was gone.  We eventually go it straightened out, but not without significant difficulty.  No one is going to Red Robin because they have the best food.  People are going for an easy, pleasant experience.  The tablet poses significant issues that significantly detract from the experience.  There are many other casual dining restaurants to choose from without experiencing that difficulty.

Tried Red Robin for the first time and was very disappointed. Three people in my party ordered the mushroom burger. We all agreed it was very bad, tasteless and dry. Not to mention my 2 year old had to wait 15 minutes for more "endless" oranges. My first and last trip to red robin.
Veronica was amazing. She was patient and helpful. Food was absolutely amazing. Drinks suggestions were amazing. Great experience.

We decided on Red Robin because there wasn't a wait on a Friday.  After we were seated it was clear why. The 90 sanitation rating was concerning too. The waitress came right away but afterward was extremely slow. We literally had to wave her down for straws, drink refills, and to get the bill. We've eaten at multiple Red Robin restaurants over the years but the quality continues to diminish. Plus the "endless fries" are a joke. They give you a few to start then take so long to bring more that you're ready to leave by the time thy come out. We won't be back.

Very disappointed in our visit. When our appetizer arrived we had no silverware still and after the waitress finally came to check she took another 5 min before bringing it, along with our meal already. One of our children's orders was wrong and after asking. For the cheese to go on the cheeseburger, she walked by 4 times before I finally asked again and then 3 min later we finally got it. She then made herself so scare that we never had a chance to get a refill on fries for the burger being shared between 2 adults. I wouldn't ever come back to this location after this experience nor would I recommend it to anyone

I went here with my Burger group back in November 2012.  I took a poll of the group and based on very subjective criteria I scored them in several different categories on a scale of 1 to 10. BUN:  5.0 BEEF:  6.0 CHEESE:  6.3 EXTRAS:  7.3 AMBIANCE:  6.3 ACCURACY:  7.3 SPEED:  7.7 VALUE:  6.7 OVERALL SCORE:  6.2 if I equate the 6.2/10 score to the 5 star rating it becomes 3.1 Stars As chain burger places go, Red Robin is pretty good.  They have a lot for kids, including baloons and good birthday celebrations.  However if you compare them to many of the local places they end up falling short and just feeling average. Overall, this is a great "franchise" style place, but for a better burger try some of the locally owned spots!

I came on Yelp just to point out what wonderful customer service Amanda provided. Everyone from our office is always ordering to-go orders and she has our food ready and knows us as we arrive. Great job!
Service was impeccable!!!!! Allergy awareness superb! We have been to many other Red Robins and this one was by far the best experience yet.

This place wildly inconsistent with service.  Some days, quick service with a smile.  Other days, like today, we have been sitting here for 8 minutes and nothing (the people next to us who sat down after us have been waited on).  I am not sure why come here. The food isn't that good (the fries are good, but not good enough to make up for crap service anymore) and there are many other options with much better service.

To sum it up: Food was disappointing, but not bad.  The service BLOWS.  Quick notes: -Wife didn't even get her beverage until the meal had arrived! -Bottomless fries? Only if you ask for more.  Good luck finding your waitress.  -Received my check WHILE waiting on second helping of fries.  Wasn't asked if we needed anything, more drink, dessert, to-go box, etc.  -It took WAY too long to get that second helping of fries. The bad part? They brought out a measly 6 fries on a plate.  The worst part?  I was asked if I wanted them to go when they finally arrived!  Only second time eating at a Red Robin. The first time was great and at a different location (Cary). This location is pretty damn bad.  Will never return.

Bottomless fries!!! What a gimmick. My hamburger came with about a dozen fries. Asked for more. They bought us 9 fries for two people. Waitress saw me count them. Burger was kinda bland. Overall about equal to McDonalds.

My kids love to go and eat here.  I love that they can get mac & cheese, and if there is a need for more, no problem...free refills on this item.  We can always find kind servers here as well.  Some even know what we order when they see us.  I am always thankful when the TV's have something other than cartoons on it as I lose my kids to the TV's when we sit down if they are one.   We always walk away from Red Robin with full bellies and happy kids.  What could be better?

So I arrive with my son to enjoy a burger. 1 hour later I ask where our food is. The waiter goes to check. The manager comes back only to tell me sorry ... the cook dropped my order. He didn't offer a thing ... not some fries to hold us over ... a promise to work on getting my order quickly ... nothing. As I get up to leave bc of how ridiculous he was and obviously upset, he then asks if there's anything he can do ... really ... AFTER I get up to leave??? No thx. Keep ur overrated burgers.

I used to really enjoy coming to this Red Robin, but I feel like it's really not such a great place to come. It took over 15 minutes to get a milkshake because there were "4 Margarita orders". Food came out just a few minutes after the appetizer. We were never offered drink refills and we waited to get boxes and checks for a long time. I know they are all busy, but if the staff were a little friendlier, it wouldn't be so bad.
Red Robin is pretty the same at all locations, which is both good and bad. The food is always the same, prices are a little high for burgers and sandwiches, and the staff is usually friendly.
Our server, Brittany,  was Awesome.  She anticipated our needs and was very happy and out going.

Service was horrible. We had to wait 10 minutes even tho plenty of tables were empty. Than not even greeted for another 20 minutes. Than over 30 minute wait for food. Burgers were fair but over priced. Choose another place for both value and price. Doubt I will be back.

Had a horrible experience.  Everything took forever.  All we ordered was some appetizers and a salad, and it still took 20 minutes.  I guess I learned that you should never order anything different than a burger.  Our server was not great, never apologized for us sitting for 10 minutes before she came over.  Just bad all around experience, mostly why I never want to eat here.

Was craving a burger, came in by myself and sat at the bar at noon on a Sunday. They were packed, but the staff were all great, and very professional. The food was excellent, went with a classic bacon cheeseburger all the way and it was gold. Great lunch spot, I will definitely be back. Oh, and on a side note, my food came out quite promptly and was delivered with a smile. Great stuff.

Had only been here once before and didn't have much of an opinion but decided to back for a late bday lunch. Staff was super friendly and attentive. Tried the Royal burger(sunnysideup egg, bacon, lettuce , tomato). Great for kids with their endless fries or sweet potato fries, great for adults if you want an adult beverage. Definitely worth a visit.

I have been to a few Red Robin's and I've never expired what I did at this particular one....I went to the Apex location for the 1st & probably last time. The night I went it was practically empty but service was still on the slow side. I ordered a cup of "french onion"...it looked weird when I  received it....really gooey on top....I then realized why...there was no "crouton/bread" in the top of the soup as how normal "french onion" soup is made....no biggie just an oversight...I brought it to the attention of my waitress..."we'll fix it" she said....now she leaves for a long period of time and returns with 2 pieces of bread with yellow cheese on top & a cup of "beer cheese"....needless to say I was confused....the beer cheese confused me because although I did ask for a side of cheese sauce for my fries with my burger I did not expect it to come out without my meal therefore sitting at the table getting cold (really didn't matter it was gross anyways)....but the 2 pieces of bread with cheese on top were definitely a mystery. Come to find out this was the bread I was to add to my now cold soup! I'm sorry but any establishment I have ever been to would make a whole new soup....this isn't a build you own soup restaurant....the cheese wasn't even the same as the kind that comes on the soup! I must say I was definitely turned off by this. Next came the burger....now I tried to be different and order the "lettuce bun"....of course I thought the "bun" was a big  piece or pieces of romaine lettuce as pictured....nope I received 1/2 of a head of iceberg lettuce literally cut in half with my burger contents in between....my burger was completely unmanageable & unedible. I literally had to dissect it....take out all the hard unedible pieces and try to assemble my own wrap. I was definitely not a happy birthday girl as this is why I was out that night. I'm not sure how long this particular Red Robin has been in this location but I am not a fan, which really sucks because I just moved to the area and I truly do love Red Robin.

If you have kids this place will provide many distractions for them. Enough to give you a couple of moments to breathe without feeling like you're neglecting them.  My 7 month old  was mesmerized by the vibrant colors used in the interior and the cartoons playing on the tv's. They recently added a Mac and Cheese dinner and it's probably the best I've ever had.   It's loaded 4 cheeses and nice and crunchy on top.     The food they serve here are mostly burgers/wraps.  I'm not a burger/sandwich person.  Red Robin is not my first choice when it comes to dining.  However, I understand why it's popular.  It's a national chain and caters to families.  Those who don't have kids may find them extremely annoying in restaurant settings (heck, so do I but then again I don't have a toddler yet).    So if you don't like the sound of children screaming during dinner, avoid Red Robin at all costs.   I will also have to make a note that they do have adult friendly drinks available and they are strong!   So maybe if you pound a couple of these back - the screaming children will seem less annoying?

This was my first here and I have to say that the food was really good. The chicken and salad that I ordered was cooked just right. My salad was fresh and crispy too which is a plus. The waitress was great since right off the bat she brought two sides of extra dressing and I didn't even have to ask.  The decor of the restaurant was very kid friendly and it is a nice family hang out. Although they had an outdoor seating area and beers too!  They have a huge selection of burgers and wraps and if you are trying to stay healthy like me, this is a good place to go!

Got teenage boys? Take'em here and let them gorge themselves with bottomless root beer floats and endless plank cut fries. Many, many different kinds of burgers and plenty of other entrees to choose from, so that picky eater will find something. Good family atmosphere, lot to look at and distract. Expect to pay 11 bucks a head for adults, unless you're taking advantage of there bar, than who knows? If you're in your early twenties you could get away with this as a first date choice. If you want a reliable, casual place to eat this is a safe bet.

I wish Yelp had a 10 star system.  I went there with my youngest daughter last week.  We ate inside.  I had the DGB burger and fries.  The burger was very good, and the fries were prepared like I remember in Belgium.  But not a single fry was longer than 2 inches.  I would have given them 4 stars had the fries not looked like the dregs of the package.  My daughter like her meal.

What do you know..I went to Red Robin after leaving a review that stated that no matter how often I go they never get my order right.  Well they did it!  They got our order right!  Way to go Red Robin.  We learned that they are under new management and that previously there had been several complaints of communcation problems between the waitstaff and kitchen staff.  So next time we go we will "test" them to see if they can get our order right again!

We use to come here often and really enjoyed the food and atmosphere. For the past year, the burgers have gone down hill faster than the service. Last 3 times now the food is not good, comes out wrong or burnt. The waitress forgets about you. Heck this time they served our food to someone else. The cheese for my pretzels was burnt which is better than last time where the pretels were burnt and hard as a rock.

Definitely a great place to fulfill my burger needs. They never cease to satisfy my cravings for unique burgers. I had the whiskey river BBQ burger while my wife had the burning love burger. Both were delicious. They have some really good appetizers too especially the onion ring tower and jalepeno coins. Definitely recommended for any burger enthusiast.

Red Robin is definitely a restaurant that caters to families with children--you're greeted by a television in the floor tuned to the Cartoon Network for goodness sakes. If you aren't a parent, or if you are a parent out on a rare night without the kids, you'll probably enjoy the atmosphere somewhere else much better. However, if you have kids in tow, this is the place for you. The kids' menu is varied, and they offer healthy side dish options such as cantaloupe and carrot sticks. The waitstaff and management seem to know that families with kids are their bread and butter, and they are gracious and attentive. During a recent visit, the manager stopped by our table and chatted with our 6-year-old son who had the macaroni. She told him that if he finished that dish he should have them bring him more. Well, when he asked for more he got it; initially the waitress charged us for the replenishment as a second order. However, when we told her what the manager had said to our son, she never questioned us and she immediately removed the charge from our bill. They also offer bottomless steak fries--a dangerous proposition indeed. We have them brought out as an appetizer and enjoy them with the meal as well. The Crispy Chicken Burger is exceptional, and my husband especially enjoys the A1 Peppercorn Burger. If you are watching your waistline, try the Ensenada Chicken Platter with the dressing on the side--it's a dieting mom's dream.

I used to frequent Red Robin in N. Raleigh but since this one was built and all the others in the area, I've stopped going.  The food is so salty you are thirsty for hours afterwards.   Prices are not great.
